text: Armenia sent a delegation to compete at the 1998 Winter Olympics in Nagano, Japan, from 7–22 February 1998. This marked the nation's second appearance at a Winter Olympics as an independent country. The Armenian delegation consisted of seven athletes: four in figure skating, one in freestyle skiing, one in cross-country skiing and one in alpine skiing. ==Alpine skiing== ;Men {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !Race 1 !Race 2 !colspan="2"|Total |- !Time !Time !Time !Rank |- |Arsen Harutyunyan |Slalom |align="center"|1:07.51 |align="center"|1:07.60 |align="center"|2:15.11 |align="center"|27 |} ==Cross- country skiing== ;Women {|class="wikitable" border="1" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan=2|Event !rowspan=2|Athlete !colspan=2|Race |- !Time !Rank |- |rowspan=4|30 km F |Alla Mikayelyan |align=center|1'44:03.6 |align=center|58 |} C = Classical style, F = Freestyle ==Figure skating== ;Pairs {|class="wikitable" border="1" style="font-size:90%" |- !Athletes !SP !FS !TFP !Rank |- align=center |align=left| Mariya Krasiltseva Aleksander Chestnikh |18 |19 |28.0 |19 |} ;Ice Dancing {|class="wikitable" border="1" style="font-size:90%" |- !Athletes !CD1 !CD2 !OD !FD !TFP !Rank |- align=center |align=left| Xenia Smetanenko Samuel Gezalian |24 |24 |24 |24 |48.0 |24 |} ==Freestyle skiing== ;Men {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="3"|Qualification !colspan="3"|Final |- !Time !Points !Rank !Time !Points !Rank |- |Armen Rafayelyan |Moguls |align="center"|25.81 |align="center"|23.49 |align="center"|19 |colspan="3"|Did not advance |} ==References== *Official Olympic Reports *WinterArmenia.com *Olympic Winter Games 1998, full results by sports- reference.com Category:1998 in Armenian sport Category:Nations at the 1998 Winter Olympics 1998
